value.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI in government
value.excerpt: It's imperative to reflect on the implications of AI in Government. Discover guidelines to set up principles and a governance model in your organization.

topItems.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI
topItems.excerpt: Explore six principles to guide AI development and use - fairness, reliability and safety, privacy and security, inclusiveness, transparency, and accountability

topItems.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI in government
topItems.excerpt: Learn guiding principles for governments, and how to choose and operationalize a governance system to responsibly and successfully use AI in the public sector.

topItems.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft
topItems.excerpt: Discover how to translate your organizationâ€™s ethical principles into actionable guidance and tools for engineering teams and how AI can improve lives worldwide

value.title: Identify principles and practices for responsible AI
value.excerpt: It's imperative to reflect on the implications of AI in business. Discover Microsoft guidelines to set up principles and a governance model in your enterprise.

topItems.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI

value.title: Introduction to Azure SQL
value.excerpt: This module introduces Azure SQL. Learn about various deployment options and service tiers and what to use for your organization.

value.title: Configure infrastructure in Azure Pipelines
value.excerpt: Run configuration management tools in Azure Pipelines to help keep your infrastructure configured as you need.

value.title: Deploy SAP certified offerings on Azure
value.excerpt: Azure provides a scalable, compliant, and enterprise-proven platform for a range of SAP workloads. In this module, you explore the platform compliance criteria that is stipulated by SAP before deploying SAP solutions in Azure, and look at the different options for deploying SAP in Azure.

value.title: Detect and analyze faces with the Face service
value.excerpt: Face detection, analysis, and recognition is an important capability for artificial intelligence (AI) solutions. The Face cognitive service in Azure makes it easy integrate these capabilities into your applications.

value.title: Detect objects in images with the Custom Vision service
value.excerpt: Object detection is a form of computer vision in which artificial intelligence (AI) agents can identify and locate specific types of object in an image or camera feed.

value.title: Explore data ingestion in Azure
value.excerpt: Explore data ingestion in Azure

value.title: Explore provisioning and deploying relational database offerings in Azure
value.excerpt: Explore provisioning and deploying relational database offerings in Azure

value.title: Introduction to Azure for SAP workloads
value.excerpt: With the recently expanded partnership between Microsoft and SAP, you can run SAP applications across development, test, and production scenarios in Azure, taking advantage of the scalability, flexibility, and cost savings of Microsoft Azure.

value.title: Introduction to implementing lambda architecture for IoT solutions
value.excerpt: An overview of the concepts and resources behind storage technologies used in IoT applications on Azure. After completing the module, you can determine when to use Blob storage, Data Lake storage, Azure Cosmos DB, and Time Series Insights.

value.title: Spark architecture fundamentals
value.excerpt: Spark architecture fundamentals

value.title: Transcribe speech input to text
value.excerpt: Speech to text from the speech service, known as speech recognition, enables real time transcription of audio streams into text. Your applications, tools, or devices can consume, display, and take action on this text as command input.

value.title: Serverless containers with Azure Container Instances (ACI) | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: In this episode, Azure CTO Mark Russinovich joins Scott Hanselman to show how you can use Azure Container Instances (ACI) to host a containerized application. Mark deploys an image processing container in three ways: as a standalone ACI container, as part of a Logic Apps workflow, and as the backend

value.title: Why did Microsoft move from ADAL to MSAL? | One Dev Question: Jean-Marc Prieur
value.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Jean-Marc Prieur, a Principal Program Manager working on the Microsoft identity platform, explains the advantages of using the Microsoft Authentication Library (MSAL) instead of the Azure Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL).   Get more information at: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/

value.title: Cloud administration basics
value.excerpt: The first learning path in a course on Cloud Administration from Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about the basics of the cloud, including the history, building blocks, and types of services, in preparation for real-world cloud practice on Azure.

topItems.title: Foundations of cloud computing for administrators
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about the cloud, including the history, building blocks, and types on your way to becoming a Cloud Administrator.

topItems.title: Provision and manage cloud services
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about the different types of resources available on the cloud and the technology behind how they work.

topItems.title: Secure your cloud resources with access control
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about digital identities and how they can be managed and synchronized within an organization.

value.title: Process and Translate Speech with Azure Cognitive Speech Services
value.excerpt: Learn how to implement the Speech services found in Azure Cognitive Services by performing speech-to-text transcription, synthesize text input to speech, perform speech translation, and implement speaker recognition in your AI infused applications

topItems.title: Transcribe speech input to text
topItems.excerpt: Speech to text from the speech service, known as speech recognition, enables real time transcription of audio streams into text. Your applications, tools, or devices can consume, display, and take action on this text as command input.

topItems.title: Synthesize Text Input to Speech
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to synthesize text to speech using the Speech-to-Text service.

topItems.title: Translate speech with the speech service
topItems.excerpt: Perform speech translation tasks with the speech service to translate spoken text to different languages.

value.title: Azure Kubernetes Service Workshop
value.excerpt: In this workshop, you'll go through tasks to deploy a multicontainer application to Kubernetes on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

value.title: Analyze images with the Computer Vision service
value.excerpt: The Computer Vision service enables software engineers to create intelligent solutions that extract information from images; a common task in many artificial intelligence (AI) scenarios.

value.title: Classify images with the Custom Vision service
value.excerpt: Image classification is a common workload in artificial intelligence (AI) applications. It harnesses the predictive power of machine learning to enable AI systems to identify real-world items based on images.

value.title: Foundations of cloud computing for administrators
value.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about the cloud, including the history, building blocks, and types on your way to becoming a Cloud Administrator.

value.title: Create a classification model with Azure Machine Learning designer
value.excerpt: Classification is a supervised machine learning technique used to predict categories or classes. Learn how to create classification models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

value.title: Automate Azure Functions deployments with Azure Pipelines
value.excerpt: Implement a CI/CD pipeline for Azure Functions.

value.title: Deploy batch inference pipelines with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Machine learning models are often used to generate predictions from large numbers of observations in a batch process. To accomplish this, you can use Azure Machine Learning to publish a batch inference pipeline.

value.title: Explore and analyze time-stamped data with Time Series Insights
value.excerpt: Azure Time Series Insights allows you to collect, process, store, analyze, and query data at Internet Of Things (IoT) scale. Learn how to deploy this service and use it to gain insights from data generated by IoT devices.
